channel.title: Project WinterLove
channel.description:
Project WinterLove, is a project I decided on creating because I am bored and have nothing to do, so I am hoping I can get into this pretty far.
[b]Information:[/b]
The goals of this project are to created a stable server from a WinterLove source (blakescape) and to make it as easy as possible to code and learn from, Ive decided on creating an API like system were I use Python scripting to do almost all the actions on the server, I will have a class file called API that will have all the needed variables, methods, booleans, etc, etc, so that I can created scripts that read from that to do the actions, kind of like powerbot (kind of, the idea not the way).
[b]Update List:[/b] [code] # Oct, 9, 10: - Cleaned out a WinterLove base, very clean now the biggest file is the Stream class. # Oct, 10, 10: -Removed TPC, both the players list and IOHost use HashMaps. # Oct, 11, 10: - Started on a better player updating system, added Python scripting, cleaned some more. [/code]
Client log in:
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/30mbxb4.jpg[/img]
Server side CMD:
[IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/2m30hzq.jpg[/img]
Packaging:
[IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/1zznaxz.jpg[/img]
If you have any suggestions, please tell me them. :D

item.title: Project WinterLove
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“glestrts, post:30, topic:363938”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=460178.msg3376803#msg3376803 date=1287691372]
I still don’t think Shard uses NIO, creativescape uses NIO for networking though.
[/quote]
Creativescape is shards?

An excerpt from shards networking showing that it at lease uses some nio.

[code]
@Override
public void run() {
while (true) {
try {
selector.select();
if (toggleShutdown) {
isShutdown = true;
break;
}
Iterator selectedIterator = selector
.selectedKeys().iterator();
while (selectedIterator.hasNext()) {
SelectionKey selectionKey = (SelectionKey) selectedIterator
.next();
selectedIterator.remove();
synchronized (this) {
if (selectionKey.isValid()) {
if (selectionKey.isAcceptable()) {
accept(selectionKey);
} else if (selectionKey.isReadable()) {
read(selectionKey);
}
}
}
}
} catch (Exception e) {
}
}
System.out.println(“Selector thread shut down.”);
if (EventManager.getSingleton().isShutdown()) {
System.exit(0);
}
}

private void accept(SelectionKey selectionKey) throws IOException,
		Exception {
	ServerSocketChannel ssc = (ServerSocketChannel) selectionKey.channel();
	SocketChannel sc = ssc.accept();
	String address = sc.socket().getInetAddress().getHostAddress();
	synchronized (IOHostList.class) {
		if (!IOHostList.has(address, Constants.MAX_CONNECTIONS_PER_IP)) {
			Misc.println_debug("Accepted connection from " + address + ".");
			IOClient ioc = PlayerManager.getSingleton().newPlayerClient(
					sc.socket(), address);
			if (ioc == null) {
				destroySocket(sc, address, false);
			} else {
				IOHostList.add(address);
				ioClientMap.put(sc, ioc);
				revIoClientMap.put(ioc, sc);
				sc.socket().setTcpNoDelay(true);
				sc.configureBlocking(false);
				sc.register(selector, SelectionKey.OP_READ);
			}
		} else {
			Misc.println_debug("Rejected connection from " + address + ".");
			destroySocket(sc, address, false);
		}
	}
}

[/code][/quote]
Give me the download for SHARD, I have to look at this.

Read full topic

item.title: Project WinterLove
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

jmood128:

I still don’t think Shard uses NIO, creativescape uses NIO for networking though.

Creativescape is shards?

An excerpt from shards networking showing that it at lease uses some nio.

	@Override
	public void run() {
		while (true) {
			try {
				selector.select();
				if (toggleShutdown) {
					isShutdown = true;
					break;
				}
				Iterator<SelectionKey> selectedIterator = selector
						.selectedKeys().iterator();
				while (selectedIterator.hasNext()) {
					SelectionKey selectionKey = (SelectionKey) selectedIterator
							.next();
					selectedIterator.remove();
					synchronized (this) {
						if (selectionKey.isValid()) {
							if (selectionKey.isAcceptable()) {
								accept(selectionKey);
							} else if (selectionKey.isReadable()) {
								read(selectionKey);
							}
						}
					}
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
			}
		}
		System.out.println("Selector thread shut down.");
		if (EventManager.getSingleton().isShutdown()) {
			System.exit(0);
		}
	}

	private void accept(SelectionKey selectionKey) throws IOException,
			Exception {
		ServerSocketChannel ssc = (ServerSocketChannel) selectionKey.channel();
		SocketChannel sc = ssc.accept();
		String address = sc.socket().getInetAddress().getHostAddress();
		synchronized (IOHostList.class) {
			if (!IOHostList.has(address, Constants.MAX_CONNECTIONS_PER_IP)) {
				Misc.println_debug("Accepted connection from " + address + ".");
				IOClient ioc = PlayerManager.getSingleton().newPlayerClient(
						sc.socket(), address);
				if (ioc == null) {
					destroySocket(sc, address, false);
				} else {
					IOHostList.add(address);
					ioClientMap.put(sc, ioc);
					revIoClientMap.put(ioc, sc);
					sc.socket().setTcpNoDelay(true);
					sc.configureBlocking(false);
					sc.register(selector, SelectionKey.OP_READ);
				}
			} else {
				Misc.println_debug("Rejected connection from " + address + ".");
				destroySocket(sc, address, false);
			}
		}
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Project WinterLove
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“glestrts, post:28, topic:363938”][quote author=Fire capez link=topic=460178.msg3376598#msg3376598 date=1287672051]

Getting it off of my portable hard-drive atm, will upload in a sec. I’m about 90% sure that shards uses nio though.

Shard doesen’t use nio.
[/quote]
i guess i was wrong. I really do not understand very much about networking.

still connections are listened for, accepted, and handled by the java.nio package.
I thought that that would entail that shards used nio, I guess not.

From IOThread.java.

import java.nio.ByteBuffer; import java.nio.channels.SelectionKey; import java.nio.channels.Selector; import java.nio.channels.ServerSocketChannel; import java.nio.channels.SocketChannel; import java.nio.channels.spi.SelectorProvider; [/quote]

I still don’t think Shard uses NIO, creativescape uses NIO for networking though.

Read full topic

i guess i was wrong. I really do not understand very much about networking.

still connections are listened for, accepted, and handled by the java.nio package.
I thought that that would entail that shards used nio, I guess not.

From IOThread.java.

import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
import java.nio.channels.SelectionKey;
import java.nio.channels.Selector;
import java.nio.channels.ServerSocketChannel;
import java.nio.channels.SocketChannel;
import java.nio.channels.spi.SelectorProvider;

item.title: Project WinterLove
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“glestrts, post:23, topic:363938”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=460178.msg3376186#msg3376186 date=1287622457]

Well I am still not sure how I am going to create an API like system so I am not going to do that any more.

I started on NIO networking, but I am not sure how I want to do that, so Ive downloaded like 10 NIO servers, bad thing is they either use Mini or Netty and not just regular NIO from Java… -.- So I am going to try my best at a fail NIO networking.

I know there is a version of paladino’s 508 server that uses nio. Shard revolutions also uses nio. Blakeman released a server called moparscape that used plain nio.

I looked at Paladinos NIO server but it is all weird and just odd to understand.

Shard the regular version uses regular IO I thought :S, and Blakeman released a few NIO servers but all the links are dead… If you have a link to one I would like to look at it to get an idea of how I could set up the networking. then i can get to the real hard work of playerUpdating.

EDIT: Ive never heard of moparscape by Blakeman, are you sure your not talking about moparscape, or Helios, or Akiane, or his incomplete NIO framework, or Enkrona or w/e I think that used NIO in one of its versions…
[/quote]
I have a framework made by blakeman called runecore.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


if you want i’ll upload.[/quote]

Yes fucking please upload it, I can also get an idea as of how I want to set up playerUpdating, I am thinking of going with how Hyperion does it but I am still not sure, I need to read Hyperion’s playerUpdating again. >.>

Read full topic

item.title: Project WinterLove
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

glestrts:

What I don’t understand is if your basically going to use the server as only an API, it would imply that It would be completely done by release. You stated that you would use python as a scripting language for nearly every feature. SO I guess my question is why, if the core is not going to be touched by anyone, would you use blakescape as your base server? goodluck though.

Because I don’t feel like writing everything. I will most likely use RSBuffer as the Buffer but for now I will keep it as is just so I can work on Playerupdating and NIO networking for the time being.

Read full topic
